Event.name: Rebellion
Event.definition:
<def-root>An individual or group, the Rebel, rejects the authority of the Current_leadership, and attempts to bring them out of power. The rebellion may, but need not be violent. Rather than expressing rebellion against the Current_leadership, the lexical units in this frame may appear with expressions describing the Current_order, the system of rule which the Rebels reject.
<ex>In 1641 there was a <fex name="reb">Catholic</fex> <t>rebellion</t> <fex name="curl">against the Protestants of Ulster</fex>, and English authority over the island was shaken.</ex>
<ex>How do they justify <fex name="reb">their</fex> <fex name="mea">armed</fex> <t>insurgency</t>?</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Rebel
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The individual or group within a society that attempts to overturn the <fen>Current_leadership</fen>, and possibly also the <fen>Current_order</fen> of governance.
<ex>In 1641 there was a <fex name="reb">Catholic</fex> <t>rebellion</t> against the Protestants of Ulster, and English authority over the island was shaken.</ex>
<ex>In the summer he crushed <fex name="reb">Geoffrey's</fex> <t>rebellion</t> and compelled him to renounce his claim.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Current_leadership
Arg.definition: <def-root>The people currently in power, whom the <fen>Rebel</fen>s attempt to overthrow. <ex>It was the first time that a man of such high rank had been put to death for <t>rebellion</t> <fex name="curl">against the king</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Current_order
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The currently-existing system of authority or government.
<ex>At the time they were in <t>rebellion</t> <fex name="curo">against the Catholic government</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location of the rebellion.
<ex>It seems probably that <t>rebellion</t> <fex name="pla">in East Anglia</fex> was as rigorously suppressed as in Kent.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time when the rebellion takes place.
<ex>Did you support the <t>insurrection</t> <fex name="tim">of 1854</fex>?</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The means by which the <fen>Rebel</fen> rebels against the authorities.
<ex>Those actions virtually guarantee that she will be facing an <fex name="mea">armed</fex> <t>revolt</t> within the week.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The degree to which the <fen>Rebel</fen> opposes and fights against the <fen>Current_leadership</fen>.
<ex>He was wary of entering into <fex name="deg">complete and utter</fex> <t>rebellion</t>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A description of the <fen>Rebel</fen> or the rebellion not covered by more specific FEs.
<ex>We face an <fex name="man">increasingly violent</fex> <t>insurgency</t> with no end in sight.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: New_order
Arg.definition: <def-root>The rebellion aims to install a <fen>New_order</fen> as their leader. This FE is more frequent with noun targets.</def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A result of the rebellion.
<ex>The old guard is trying furiously to put an end to what has been an <fex name="res">extremely headly</fex> <t>rebellion</t>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The length of time of the rebellion.
<ex>The <fex name="dur">months-long</fex> <t>insurgency</t> has taken its toll on an already-reeling nation.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: insurgency.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an uprising or rebellion, often violent.

lexUnit.name: insurgent.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person participating in a violent rebellion.

lexUnit.name: rebel.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: act, often violently, in opposition to the existing order.

lexUnit.name: rebel.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person fighting to change the leadership in a nation.
